title: Man Utd predicted line-up for Newcastle match in Premier League
text:
Get the biggest Manchester United FC stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

Ole Gunnar Solskjaer is expected to field a much-changed team when Manchester United face Newcastle United on Sunday.

Solskjaer and his squad are back in Premier League action after a goalless draw in Thursday's Europa League game at AZ Alkmaar.

The United boss is likely to be without Jesse Lingard for the trip to St James' Park after the England midfielder became the latest member of his squad to be hit by the current injury curse.

Despite only coming on as a 77th minute substitute in The Hague, Lingard was forced off before the final whistle with a hamstring problem and is unlikely to feature.

The 26-year-old joins a growing list of absentees at Old Trafford, with striker Anthony Martial currently sidelined by the thigh injury he sustained against Crystal Palace six weeks ago.

(Image: PA)

Meanwhile Luke Shaw is still recovering from a hamstring strain suffered in the same game and Paul Pogba is not expected to return until after the international break due to the ankle issue that kept him in Manchester last week.

When asked if any of the injured players are expected to return at Newcastle, Solskjaer said : “Probably not [but] let's see on Saturday morning.



“Paul? Probably not. There's the international break to come and that might be the time to give them 10-14 days extra to get them ready for the Liverpool game.”

Meanwhile, Solskjaer confirmed that some of those who played in midweek are in line to keep their places for the league clash.

(Image: EMPICS Sport)

Although goalkeeper David De Gea is almost certain to keep his place in goal, Victor Lindelof looks set to be only survivor from the back four that played against AZ.

Harry Maguire was an unused substitute in that game and is expected to partner the Swede in the heart of defence, while captain Ashley Young is also expected to return after missing the trip altogether.

Axel Tuanzebe, who remained on the bench with Maguire in midweek, is expected to cover for Aaron Wan-Bissaka once again, with question marks still remaining over the full-back's fitness.

Despite recent struggles with a minor groin problem, Marcus Rashford is also in line to return to the starting XI after a cameo appearance in Holland, while Andreas Pereira and Scott McTominay are set for recalls to join Nemanja Matic in midfield after featuring against Arsenal a week ago.

Meanwhile, Solskjaer is set to stick with youngsters Mason Greenwood and Daniel James, with both making impressive starts to their Old Trafford careers.

Man Utd predicted XI: De Gea, Tuanzebe, Maguire, Lindelof, Young, McTominay, Matic, Pereira, James, Rashford, Greenwood
description: After their goalless draw with AZ Alkmaar in the Europa, Manchester United return to Premier League action at St James' Park
